summary: The 'Rio San José and Rio Jemez Water Settlements Act of 2025' addresses water rights claims of the Pueblos of Acoma and Laguna in the Rio San José Stream System and the Pueblos of Jemez and Zia in the Rio Jemez Stream System in New Mexico. It approves settlements, ratifies related agreements, authorizes funding for infrastructure, and outlines the roles of the Secretary of the Interior. The bill details definitions, settlement trust funds, waivers, releases of claims, and the Enforceability Date, aiming to achieve fair and final settlements of water rights disputes and authorize funds for implementation.
